title: 'Hindi is not national language': BJP's Annamalai backs Ravichandran Ashwin's remark - The Times of India
summary:
Hindi is not national language: BJP's Annamalai backs Ravichandran Ashwin's remark

Date: October 5, 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, BJP leader Annamalai supported cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin's comments that Hindi should not be considered the national language of India.

  • Annamalai emphasized that India is a diverse nation with numerous languages.
  • He pointed out the importance of respecting all regional languages.
  • Ashwin's remark has sparked a broader conversation about linguistic diversity in India.
"Hindi is one of the languages, but we must prioritize the recognition of all languages in India." - Annamalai

This statement has drawn both support and criticism from various political and social groups, highlighting the ongoing debate about language and identity in India.
newTitle: BJP's Annamalai Supports Ashwin's View on Hindi Language

summary:
RJ Mahvash breaks SILENCE over Yuzvendra Chahal dating rumours, makes big claim

Publication Date: Recent Update | Source: India.com

RJ Mahvash has addressed the rumors connecting her to cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal. She expressed anger over the unfounded allegations in a recent Instagram post.

  • RJ Mahvash claims the dating rumors are baseless and stemmed from her being seen with a man.
  • She criticized the mentality behind such assumptions and expressed her decision to not let her name be involved in false claims.
  • Yuzvendra Chahal also faced divorce rumors with Dhanashree Verma concurrently.
"It's literally funny to see how baseless these rumours are. If you get SEEN with an opposite gender, are you dating that person?" - RJ Mahvash

In conclusion, RJ Mahvash has taken a strong stance against the rumors, demanding respect for her personal life and clarifying the misinformation circulating online.
newTitle: RJ Mahvash Responds to Yuzvendra Chahal Dating Rumors

IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights (1/10/2025): IND-W beat IRE-W by 6 wickets, IND-W vs IRE-W Full Scorecard - Hindustan Times
summary:
IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights (1/10/2025): IND-W beat IRE-W by 6 wickets

Publication Date: 1/10/2025

Source: Sports News

India Women (IND-W) defeated Ireland Women (IRE-W) by 6 wickets in the first ODI of the series. The match showcased notable performances from both teams, with Ireland's captain Gaby Lewis scoring 92 runs and IND-W's Pratika Rawal being named Player of the Match for her batting excellence.

  • IND-W successfully chased down a target of 239 runs set by IRE-W.
  • Pratika Rawal played a critical role in the chase and was recognized for her performance.
  • Smriti Mandhana praised the team’s bowlers for their efforts on a challenging pitch.
  • Despite 56/4, Ireland managed to set a competitive total aided by a strong partnership.
  • The teams are set to meet again on January 12 for the second ODI.
“Every game holds equal importance.” - Smriti Mandhana

The match highlights the strengths and areas for improvement for both teams as they prepare for future games in the series.
newTitle: IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights: India Wins by 6 Wickets

title: "Gautam Gambhir Lagging Behind...": Coach's Every Error In Australia Tour Brutally Singled Out - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Lagging Behind...: Coach's Every Error In Australia Tour Brutally Singled Out

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir faces criticism after his team's losses against New Zealand and Australia. Former teammate Mohammad Kaif has pointed out several tactical errors made by Gambhir during the Australia tour.

  • Gambhir has received backlash for back-to-back Test series losses.
  • Mohammad Kaif expressed concerns over Gambhir's tactics in a viral video.
  • Kaif questioned Gambhir's decisions regarding player selections in key matches.
  • The BCCI plans to review Gambhir's performance along with captain Rohit Sharma.
“The best coach is always the one who is tactically No. 1,” Kaif stated, emphasizing the need for Gambhir to justify his decisions.

Criticism of Gambhir's coaching abilities raises questions about the future of the Indian cricket team and its strategy moving forward.

David's 68* overshadows Warner's 88* in Hurricanes win - Cricbuzz
summary:
David's 68* overshadows Warner's 88* in Hurricanes win

Published on: Fri, Jan 10, 2025, 12:25 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

In a thrilling Big Bash League match, the Hobart Hurricanes achieved a 6-wicket victory over Sydney Thunder, propelled by Tim David’s explosive unbeaten 68, overshadowing David Warner’s impressive 88 not out.

  • Hobart Hurricanes recorded their fifth win of the season.
  • David Warner scored 88 runs off 66 balls for Sydney Thunder.
  • Tim David scored 68 runs off 38 balls, leading the Hurricanes to victory.
  • The Hurricanes chased down the target of 165 with 19 balls remaining.
  • Warner's innings included a struggle with slower deliveries before a late acceleration.
"Hurricanes kept chipping away with regular wickets and the Thunder batters struggled to find the momentum either."

The match showcased the remarkable performance of Tim David, reinforcing the Hurricanes' strong position at the top of the table.
newTitle: David's 68* overshadows Warner's 88* in Hurricanes win

summary:
India's Champions Trophy 2025 And England Series Squad Announcement Live

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is announcing the squads for the upcoming series against England and the Champions Trophy 2025. Both squads are expected to be revealed today, with significant changes anticipated in light of India's recent performances.

  • The BCCI selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, will make bold calls after India’s 1-3 defeat to Australia in the Test series.
  • Provisional squads must be submitted by February 12, 2025, with allowed changes until February 13, 2025.
  • India will face England in five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22 in Kolkata.
  • Key players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to remain in the squad despite concerns about their recent form.
“We need to look beyond some players currently in the squad,” stated BCCI sources.

India’s performance in the upcoming matches will be critical as they prepare for the ICC Champions Trophy in Dubai.
newTitle: Squad Announcement for India's Champions Trophy and England Series: Key Updates

PCB Reacts As Rumours Of Champions Trophy Moving Out Of Country Continue To Spread - NDTV Sports
summary:
PCB Addresses Rumors of ICC Champions Trophy Relocation

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has denied rumors that the ICC Champions Trophy will be moved out of the country due to delays in stadium construction.

  • The tournament is set to begin on February 19, with matches scheduled at three venues: Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium, Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore, and National Bank Stadium in Karachi.
  • All matches involving India will take place in Dubai.
  • The PCB has invested nearly PKR 12 billion to upgrade the stadiums for the tournament.
  • An ICC delegation is currently in Pakistan to monitor preparations, indicating the event is on track.
“Just 40 days left for the Champions Trophy and this is the condition of cricket stadiums in Pakistan.” — R A T N I S H

The PCB emphasizes that it is closely monitoring stadium conditions and aims to resolve any outstanding issues before the matches.
newTitle: PCB Addresses Rumors of ICC Champions Trophy Relocation

title: IND-W vs IRE-W Highlights, 1st ODI: India take 1-0 lead in series with six-wicket victory over hosts - The Financial Express
summary:
India Women Secure Six-Wicket Victory Over Ireland in 1st ODI

Date: 10 Jan 2025
Source: Financial Express

India Women started their tour of Ireland successfully by winning the first ODI with a six-wicket margin, chasing down Ireland’s total comfortably.

  • India Women chased down Ireland's target of 239 runs, ending at 240/4 in 34.3 overs.
  • Ireland posted 238/7 in their 50 overs, with notable contributions from Gaby Lewis (92) and Leah Paul (59).
  • Pratika Rawal top-scored for India with 89 runs, supported by Smriti Mandhana’s quick 41 and Tejal Hasabnis with an unbeaten 53.
  • Indian bowlers performed well, with Priya Mishra taking 2 wickets for 56 runs and Aimee Maguire claiming 3 for 57 for Ireland.
  • The win gave India a 1-0 lead in the series, setting up excitement for the next matches.
"India's efficient batting performance and disciplined bowling efforts were key to their victory."

Looking ahead, India aims to maintain their winning momentum in the upcoming ODI matches against Ireland.
newTitle: India Women Secure Six-Wicket Victory Over Ireland in 1st ODI

title: THIS bowler use to bowl 150kmph but retired ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025, his name is... - India.com
summary:
Varun Aaron Retires Ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India.com

Indian cricketer Varun Aaron has announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 35, marking the end of a promising career that was hindered by injuries.

  • Aaron was known for his ability to bowl at speeds of up to 150 km/h.
  • Despite early successes, recurring injuries significantly impacted his career.
  • He thanked the National Cricket Academy and various organizations for their support during his recovery.
  • Aaron expressed excitement about exploring new opportunities beyond cricket.
  • During his international career, he played 9 Test matches and 9 ODIs, taking a total of 29 wickets.
“I am looking forward to the new chapter in my life while staying connected to the sport I love.” - Varun Aaron

Aaron’s retirement highlights the challenges faced by athletes in maintaining their careers amid injuries, while also looking forward to life beyond competitive sports.
newTitle: Varun Aaron Retires Ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025

In a surprising turn of events, KKR spinner Varun Chakravarthy is reportedly in contention for a spot on Team India's ICC Champions Trophy 2025 squad, ahead of experienced players like Ravindra Jadeja.

  • Chakravarthy's selection is notable as he has yet to play in ODIs but performed well in IPL 2024.
  • His mentor, Gautam Gambhir, is now the head coach of the Indian team, which may influence his selection.
  • Other candidates include Kuldeep Yadav, who needs to prove his fitness, and Ravi Bishnoi, among others.
  • Selector trends suggest a potential shift away from established players like Jadeja in ODIs.
“Chakravarthy has emerged as one of the leading candidates to lead India's spin-bowling attack in Dubai for the Champions Trophy.”

Chakravarthy's rise represents a unique opportunity for a player developing in the domestic circuit, with implications for team dynamics as upcoming competitions approach.

After facing rejection in the IPL auction, Prithvi Shaw takes a significant step towards a comeback by concentrating on his fitness and enhancing his game skills.

title: Formula 1: Andy Cowell named Aston Martin team principal - BBC.com
summary:
Andy Cowell Takes Charge as Aston Martin Team Principal

Publication Date: October, 2023 | Source: Formula 1 News

Aston Martin has appointed Andy Cowell as their new team principal, alongside his role as CEO, marking significant restructuring within the team.

The changes come as the team aims to reposition itself as a contender for the F1 championship following previous challenges in performance.

  • Cowell transitions from Mercedes to lead Aston Martin.
  • Enrico Cardile joins as chief technical officer from Ferrari.
  • Design legend Adrian Newey will work alongside Cowell.
  • The team aims to revamp its performance after inconsistent results in the last two seasons.
“I have been incredibly impressed by the dedication and commitment of this team,” said Cowell.

Aston Martin's ambitions include a switch to Honda engines in 2026 and a commitment to creating a championship-winning team.
newTitle: Andy Cowell Takes Charge as Aston Martin Team Principal

Andy Cowell becomes Team Principal at Aston Martin as Mike Krack moves to new role in restructure - Formula 1
summary:
Andy Cowell becomes Team Principal at Aston Martin as Mike Krack moves to new role in organisational restructure

Date: Unknown | Source: Formula 1®

Aston Martin has announced a significant organizational restructure with Andy Cowell being appointed as Team Principal while retaining his CEO position. Mike Krack will transition to Chief Trackside Officer.

  • Andy Cowell will further integrate his role, overseeing Aerodynamics, Engineering, and Performance Departments.
  • Mike Krack, previously Team Principal since 2022, will focus on car performance on track.
  • New Chief Technical Officer Enrico Cardile will lead race car development.
  • Tom McCullough remains in a leadership role, aiming to expand racing categories.
“These organizational changes are a natural evolution of the multi-year plans that we have scheduled to make and I'm incredibly excited about the future.” - Andy Cowell

The restructuring aims to enhance team performance and prepare for Aston Martin's transition to a full works team by 2026.
newTitle: Andy Cowell Takes on Team Principal Role at Aston Martin

Aston Martin name new team principal in reshuffle - Racingnews365.com
Breaking: Aston Martin name new team principal in reshuffle - Racingnews365.com
summary:
Aston Martin Appoints Andy Cowell as New F1 Team Principal

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Aston Martin has announced the appointment of Andy Cowell as the new Formula 1 team principal, succeeding Mike Krack, who has been reassigned to chief trackside officer.

  • Andy Cowell, previously CEO and head of Mercedes High Performance Powertrains, will combine the roles of CEO and team principal.
  • Mike Krack, appointed in 2022, transitions to chief trackside officer.
  • The team's structure includes dedicated trackside and factory-based teams reporting to Cowell.
  • Enrico Cardile has been named chief technical officer, overseeing the development of new race cars.
“I have spent the last three months understanding and assessing our performance, and I've been incredibly impressed by the dedication, commitment and hard work of this team,” explained Cowell.
“With the completion of the AMR Technology Campus and our transition in 2026 to a full works team... we are on a journey to becoming a Championship-winning team.”

The leadership changes are part of Aston Martin's multi-year strategy to enhance their F1 team's competitiveness.
newTitle: Aston Martin Appoints Andy Cowell as New F1 Team Principal
